snippet: The case involving an assault on a sheep herder’s daughter tested the system’s ability to hold a controversial security force accountable.
abstract: Afghan judicial panel finds four members of Afghan Local Police guilty of involvement in rape of sheep herder's daughter Lal Bibi and sentences them to 16 years in prison; case tests judicial system's ability to hold controversial force accountable.

byline.original: By JAWAD SUKHANYAR and ALISSA J. RUBIN
byline.contributor: Jawad Sukhanyar reported from Kabul, and Alissa J. Rubin from Paris. Habib Zahori contributed reporting from Kabul.

lead_paragraph: The case involving an assault on a sheep herder’s daughter tested the system’s ability to hold a controversial security force accountable.

headline.seo: Afghan Police Members Found Guilty in Rape
headline.main: 4 Members of Afghan Police Are Found Guilty in Rape
headline.print_headline: 4 Members of Afghan Police Are Found Guilty in Rape
